newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asian dollar deposits little changed in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Asian dollar deposits little changed in late trade.

text.p: Asian dollar deposit rates were little changed in lacklustre trade, dealers said on Wednesday.

They said most traders were sidelined ahead of tonight's 1330 GMT release of the U.S. September international trade data, which is forecast to have narrowed to a deficit of US$9.5 billion compared with a deficit of US$10.83 billion reported in August.

"The market was quietly steady in the morning except for some light activity at the short and long ends. Some people are waiting for possible direction from tonight's release of the (U.S.) international trade figures," a local dealer said.
In day-to-day rates, Wednesday/Thursday rose 1/8 percentage point to 5-1/2 5-3/8 percent.
Thursday/Friday and week-fixed were unchanged from Tuesday's common 5-3/8 5-1/4 percent, respectively.
Among longer dates, one-month was unchanged at 5-3/8 5-1/4 percent, three-months unchanged at 5-1/2 5-3/8 and nine-months unchanged at 5-9/16 5-7/16 percent.
